summary: The CONNECT for Health Act of 2025 aims to expand access to telehealth services under Medicare. Key provisions include removing geographic requirements, expanding eligible practitioners and originating sites, and supporting telehealth in Federally Qualified Health Centers and Rural Health Clinics.  The bill also addresses program integrity, enhances beneficiary and provider support through resources, and mandates the inclusion of telehealth in quality of care measures. It further requires the posting of information on telehealth services.
